message.content:
Of course! Here's a weekly healthy meal plan that caters to your dietary restrictions. This plan includes balanced meals with a variety of protein sources and whole foods while avoiding dairy, garlic, honey, almonds, pistachios, and cashews.

Monday:
- Breakfast: Omelette made with egg whites, spinach, and bell peppers (use a non-dairy alternative like tofu or tempeh for the egg substitute). Serve with whole grain toast.
- Lunch: Quinoa and black bean salad with roasted veggies (such as zucchini, cherry tomatoes, and red onion) and avocado dressing (made without garlic and honey).
- Dinner: Baked salmon with lemon and herbs, served with steamed broccoli and quinoa.

Tuesday:
- Breakfast: Smoothie made with mixed berries (like strawberries, blueberries, and raspberries), banana, spinach, and almond milk or a plant-based milk.
- Lunch: Brown rice and lentil soup with a side of kale salad dressed in olive oil and lemon juice.
- Dinner: Grilled tofu skewers with vegetables like bell peppers, onions, and mushrooms. Serve on a bed of mixed greens without nuts.

Wednesday:
- Breakfast: Overnight oats with chia seeds, almond milk, and your favorite fruits (such as mango or pineapple).
- Lunch: Chickpea salad with cucumber, tomato, and avocado in a lemon-tahini dressing.
- Dinner: Zucchini noodles (zoodles) with turkey meatballs (made from ground turkey) and marinara sauce. Serve a side of steamed green beans.

Thursday:
- Breakfast: Avocado toast on whole grain bread with smoked salmon or tempeh bacon.
- Lunch: Salad bowl with mixed greens, roasted sweet potato, black beans, and a citrus vinaigrette (skip garlic).
- Dinner: Baked portobello mushrooms stuffed with quinoa and veggies, topped with a sprinkle of nutritional yeast for flavor.

Friday:
- Breakfast: Scrambled tofu with sautéed spinach and tomatoes, served with whole grain toast.
- Lunch: Turkey or veggie wrap with hummus, lettuce, tomato, and cucumber.
- Dinner: Grilled chicken or tempeh stir-fry with mixed vegetables (like broccoli, carrots, and snap peas) and a low-sodium soy sauce.

Saturday:
- Breakfast: Smoothie bowl with frozen berries, coconut yogurt, and topped with granola (make your own without nuts).
- Lunch: Lentil and vegetable curry over brown rice.
- Dinner: Baked tofu or tempeh with roasted asparagus and sweet potato.

Sunday:
- Breakfast: Veggie and quinoa frittata with bell peppers, onions, and mushrooms.
- Lunch: Mediterranean bowl with falafel (made without nuts), hummus, cucumber salad, and pita bread.
- Dinner: Zucchini and mushroom stuffed bell peppers with a side of mixed greens and balsamic vinaigrette.

Remember to always drink plenty of water throughout the day and adjust portion sizes according to your individual needs. Enjoy your healthy week!
